intro: Pterisanthes beccariana, commonly known as the Beccari's pterisanthes, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Araliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
